g.text: This is probably a keycloak-gatekeeper specific implementation -
to generate the OpenID redirect to the provider
Also set OAuth Token Request State (CSRF Protection)
Return login form with parameters from httpbin's request stored in a JWT.
Keycloak's CSRF protection is handled using server-side sessions
Username and password POSTed in Body
Keycloak session ID, httpbin's request JWT returned to Keycloak in Headers
&session_state=<Keycloak parameter to link this redirect with token set in cookie on Keycloak site>
Also set cookie on Keycloak site to indicate that user has logged in
&session_state=<Keycloak parameter to link this redirect with token set in cookie on Keycloak site>
Also send cookie with OAuth Token Request State (CSRF Protection)
Return Access Token and Refresh Token
Also set Access Token in a Cookie (kc-access)
Access Token lasts 5 min by default
Also set Refresh Token in a Cookie (kc-state)
Refresh Token is encrypted with a symmetric key (in gatekeeper config)
This time with Access Token and Refresh Token in Header (from Cookie)
This time with Access Token and Refresh Token in Header (from Cookie)
Access To Same Application After Access Token Expires
This time with Access Token and Refresh Token in Header (from Cookie)
Return New Access Token and Refresh Token
with new Access Token and Refresh Token (encrypted) set as cookie
